QkbivfTQ36SODoz318QhwA.text: The chicken was fine, nothing special. They give you a lot of it. The biggest problem I had was that I was robbed while I ate it. If you dine in, watch your back.

pQ_BRtUpY5WPoLPM_x0bxw.text: This is a good Nandos as staff were eager to help and food was nice and spicy. I tried the one in Camden but it wasnt as good. Give it a go.

oux-JhcRul7B8xR0IAE0zg.text: Quite small for a restuarant as popular as nandos, lacks individual customer care, but stafff compensate by speed.

zTNrSW9JyP0yCNmPN50aPw.text: Nandos is always good and this place is no exception.. I especially like the very spicy chicken... I just wish there were more of these places... just been more Nandos and less KFC

C3pyJYYDfQLRE6mdx5zzBg.text: I love Nandos,especially the one in Earls court. I just feel comfortable here. Macho peas are just delicious!:)

-jFaWLbjYZVijr0uJ86nyA.text: Ate here Christmas Day because it was open and near the hotel.  Not usually a big chain fan, but the food was great the service was good.  Great price for a set Christmas Day dinner that filled us up and was pleasantly spicy. I echo others here in wishing we had more of these in the states.

6Kv7Azm-tLDlVIymV42dsw.text: During my first trip to London, I ate at this Nando's at least three times. It would order the same thing everytime..1/4 Lemon Herb Chicken with Chips and Coleslaw. What I remember the most is that the chicken was full of flavor and was not dry. A trip to London for me is not complete without a meal at Nando's...

k2y2bOAS8LvbL5fEJB55Yw.text: I liked it, the free refills was a nice American touch also for those of us on this side of the Atlantic.  Was a bit busy, but we got a table fairly fast.  This is NOT Mexican food though.  Not in the least.  This location also has its restroom down in the basement which can be awkward for a line as I don't really remember much of a landing to stand on after the stairs.

5WyrYgQE79dO9n5Zj32M1w.text: I make sure to go to Nandos every time I'm in London- their Peri Peri chicken is so good! An easy way to grab a bit before hitting the pub.

GbQxCguxbFEf57wmh-knuA.text: I know it's a chain, but I really like this place and hope to see more in the US (I've been told they've just opened one in D.C.?).  Paul is absolutely right, the free refills is a very nice American touch.  I love the spicy chicken sandwiches, the pineapple in addition to the varying degrees of their hot sauce really make the sandwich.  Oh and this is NOT Mexican yelp!

v7kRcG6iYbBE3FkfXqCpBA.text: This is was our first meal after a long flight and check in. Our hotel wasnt far from here, so we walk in.  It was a little crowed but we were hungry so we gave it a go. The food was good and well priced...

0LjtHDDf786X4PwjVUgV1Q.text: The shop was one of the best eating place in Earls court.The shop was not very big and in the evening,it was usually full of people.The shop basically the same with other Nando's,the chicken was nice cooked,great sauce,unlimited refill drink.The staff here was one of the best I had even seen,very friendly and prefessional,everything time been there was was happy experience.

23n8YolAtQ1_DZhYEB82qw.text: Never sat in this Nandos, I just decided on Monday night whilst perusing Earl's Court Road's fast food joints that Nandos was the one for me, and so in I popped to order myself half a chicken. When I went in about 8pm it was chaotically busy, so I'm glad I wasn't hoping to sit down. I went up and placed my order, and was told it would be about a 15 minute wait, which bothered me not one bit. Surprisingly, after only 5 minutes of waiting on the little bench next to the free refill soda bit, out came my meal. The staff were really nice in here, and served with a smile. I'm not the biggest fan of Nandos, but I cannot fault my experience in this one!

oK97sbb4s_1GHjGZ-pf0RQ.text: I was introduced to the concept of Nandos by Jonathan Richardson, as he occasionally makes mention of it on the bootleg copies of "8 out of 10 Cats" my wife and I religiously watch here in the states. All I know is that they served chicken, and lots of it. I didn't know if it was African, Portuguese, or Chilean. I just knew they had chicken and different sauces. I didn't know if it was fast-food, a dive, or a fancy restaurant. Just that Jon Richardson gets takeaway from there and eats it all alone because he has bad luck with the ladies.My boss insisted on going to Nandos; he lived in London for about six months and had an affinity for the chain, so we went. And waited about 20 minutes to be seated, as we approached during the lunch rush. The chicken and sides were pretty good, some of the sauces too spicy for my tender palate, but it was still pretty tasty. It certainly wasn't worth the 20 minute wait, and if I'm lucky enough to require a fast-food lunch option in the UK, I'll certainly choose Nandos over McDonald's or the fare at the touristy-end of Camden Market.

S-WDMGpDfA8BMbKSHNJ50Q.text: Yum, we could really use a Nando's over here in LA. It would be a huge hit! My boyfriend and I stayed in London for 10 days and ended up at this location on 3 occasions. Every single time we loved our meal and ended up paying less than we would've at a "fancier" restaurant. Yes, it's a chain, but don't judge this place based on that. The Portuguese-South African style chicken is great. We tried the wraps and also the various meals that came with sides. Corn is good here and mashed potatoes! Also enjoyed the fries; make sure they don't forget to put the spices on them. We got these meals "hot" and could feel our lips tingling after each meal. On our third visit we got a free 1/4 chicken meal, which was nice. And they serve cider! Sauces are amazing. Love the garlic and also had the very hot sauce; YUM. Should've figured out how to bring some back to the USA! It gets crowded here and after one visit you can tell why.

Dvs7_34bDBPJ8Cxy4mJuRg.text: When I was in London a few weeks ago, I ate here twice. The first time I went with friends the server asked if we had been there before and when we replied no, he sat us at a table and left. It wasn't until 20 minutes later waiting for him to come back that another server came over to us - mostly likely because we looked confused as to why we hadn't been served yet - and explained that you order at the counter. That aside, the food is amazing. I had the mango and lime wings with peri-salted chips and a salad. It was surprisingly filling but rather expensive in my opinion once you convert the 8.99 to American dollars. I'd definitely come back on my next trip though!

ccTK1tEErFW3LEY8uAstHg.text: We came from the States and told that we HAD to try Nandos.  It did not disappoint!!!  I got the Butterfly Chicken Breast - Medium Spice.  OMG!!!  This was one of the best things I have ever tried!!!  The flavors of the spice are amazing.  Glad I went with the medium.  I could have done spicier, but I don't think I would have enjoyed the flavors as much.  I wish we had these in Los Angeles!!  I have cravings for it and no Nandos to cure it!!The only draw back is that you have to stand in line to order vs a waiter.  The lines can get pretty long and don't move that fast.

o2hxNfBqpyV9k_OJE4jhlQ.text: Nandos is a good restaurant for what it is (quick and easy). It's too good to call fast food, but is almost as easy and reasonably priced.  It's great place to go with a group of friends and easily become a good regular.  It basically does chicken and does it well.  You chose how spicy you'd like it and that's pretty much the whole story. However the chicken livers is something the more daring MUST try!

photos.caption: Photo of Nando's - London, United Kingdom. Grill Station
Photo of Nando's - London, United Kingdom. Nandos Entrance

dBtQwY5ToFsafqb1Ddn6eA.text: I'm really struggling to understand why anyone likes this place. During a conference, I was stuck eating out only own and I really just wanted take away to be able to unwind at the hotel while still receiving some nourishment.  In the past, I have heard people rave about Nandos, so I have it a try. I got the butterfly chicken with mild sauce, the halloumi cheese and a salad. What a disappointment? The flavor profile just isn't there. The chicken was entirely bland.  The halloumi cheese was fine, but only because halloumi is the only ingredient. Go to Pret or some other place...

qZ_IIMSOWTDtoNnj4OPeNA.text: Fast food Portuguese style.  I had the chicken breast, extra spicy and the spice is excellent.  Could've used a bit more lettuce but if I'm back and wanting something quick, I'd go back.

w_Fk3GFqOTa7jT-UnkhG0A.text: Always great to have a healthy fast-food option when travelling for business.  There were a couple of nights I'd return to Kensington after a long day, and even longer commute looking for something quick, healthy, and not room service.  Nando's fit the bill.  Grilled chicken breast marinated in some tasty Portuguese spices.  If the marinade isn't enough, you have the choice of some of the banging peri-peri sauces (garlic, chili, etc) they have stocked throughout the restaurant.This place stays open late, and like I said was an Oasis for a travel weary business-guy who spent the afternoon navigating the network of trains and tubes throughout Southeast England.

J1udvrKCw0xQcnz6EPdaDg.text: Visited earls court in late may. Saw this place. It's was soo good. I will visit their location in Washington D.C. Now! I can't wait! Spicy is best!

3ODP-zLa8Xy4D4uoXxQGww.text: What can I say, fresh grilled chicken with varying levels of spiciness.  I was first introduced to Nandos in South Africa.Healthy and good tasting. Always prepared fresh and a different twist on what Americans expect from "fast" food. Not a fancy place (it's a chain) but good, consistent food.  If you get the chips (fries to us Americans) ask for no salt, they can be very, very salty.

UWQ8B_QPAAhn-eyP1-MZhQ.text: I've been a Nando's fan since first trying it in South Africa 9 years ago.  I've eaten it in Malaysia and used to buy their sauces whenever I could back in San Francisco.  I'm hooked.I've lived in London for 5 days and have already eaten here twice.  Even if I could control my cravings, which I clearly can't, their frequent chicken-eaters card makes it impossible to resist.  After 3 purchases of 6 pounds you get a free 1/4 chicken?  That's the best ROI of any restaurant card I've ever seen.And if that weren't enough, this place might just have the best service of any restaurant in London, high-end or otherwise.

41woRjEiJzydN-vWVxNH0g.text: I'm a huge fan, Free refills on Soda  which is never  available in  London, and good prices that  offer portion sizes really fill you up. The chicken is very tasty with a good amount of kick if you order it with hot, or regular level. The part of this restaurant that really strives to be unique, and it works, London is such a  huge city with many different cultures all living together, but Nando's fits right in, and tastes amazing. The peri peri sides are extravagant indeed. the Sangria was amazing, fresh and strong enough to give a kick but not so much that you would not like it There really is something for everything here, I can't wait to see how the American Version in DC holds up, I'm going their location soon.

IfgjJP1cYJ7zP8scJiubgw.text: Been here once for lunch quite a few years back...I had a few piece chicken meal, I believe, and it was rather tasty, despite the fact that the pieces are small - at least to American standards. Despite that, it was very tasty with quite a bit of spice to it.The sides were unremarkable, but decent. Somehow it didn't have the kick that I would of expected it to have, but it doesn't detract from the culinary experience of eating at Nando's.Otherwise, seating was fairly plenty, decor is good, and I recall the place being clean too.Having said this, I need to go back and have at it again.

aqKqvSNajvQ5GHVwH4auZA.text: I was in this restaurant recently and I found the service a bit slow. The food was average and I think the chickens a bit over-cooked and dry. I know this is a fast food restaurant but a freshly cooked chicken shouldn't be dry and over-cooked.I also would like to see a better selection of juices and other healthier options.I think they need a bit of refresh, then I can give better ratings

cweKo7wqlxBBlC00jF574A.text: You can NOT go wrong with this restaurant! I have been eating here for years and never been disappointed! Quick,good and cheap!

HQeBoCUA-ejSxBWiL39_Lg.text: OK, Yelp. Nando's is not Mexican. Not even remotely close to Mexican. Nando's is South African-Portuguese. Just because they make a hot sauce does not make it Mexican.Moving on. This Nando's was where I spent my 23rd birthday, a few blocks from my hostel and a few days after moving to London. My boyfriend and I had spent the whole day pounding the pavement, looking for jobs and flats.Nando's had a feature rare in the UK--free refills on soda. I love soda. My boyfriend and I would sometimes go there, just to fill up on our favorite empty calories while munching away at spicy chicken sandwiches. I still remember the excellent roll their sandwiches were on, and their fries. Peri-peri good, indeed. Their sauces are hot, but not so hot my manly-man boyfriend couldn't handle the extra-hot. I myself would go with the regular hot, though they do have some totally bland sauces for those with whiny friends. Come to America, Nando's.

LqmX-WnY0jweaDgS2Z_GtA.text: Great value and nice atmosphere at the Earl's Court location.  I had a wrap with the mango spice- delicious and very fresh.  Mashed on the side and they were flavorful and yummy.  All staff were very friendly.  I might just make my way back while on this same trip!

9KZ4BVQRWquQeKs4rKgFtQ.text: It's slightly "Fast food " chain restaurant, but the chicken is really delicious.In a city as expensive as London, Nandos is a great choice if you're looking for delicious food at a relatively low price. The decoration is simple, not over done, and its a very casual place. Sometimes the wait can be a little long I think, but it's a good place to sit and relax with a small group of friends and eat some really delicious chicken!

h6TLLPLBRxD1J_hivmQnMQ.text: Really good food for the price, and the Earl's Court location had a bright, lively atmosphere. The chicken was tasty... had a good char, not overdone, and was nicely seasoned. I loved the peri peri sauce. The spice/heat level was a pleasant surprise.  Would definitely recommend Nandos to anyone staying in London. Yeah it's a franchise, but my meal at Nando's beat out some forgettable meals at places that charged more than double.

gupr6QEhkwBoRbv87GfnLQ.text: Came in on a Saturday night after getting off a flight from Berlin. It was packed inside, but we were greeted promptly by a cheerful waitress. I explained that it was our first time and she kindly explained how things worked, then we were seated within minutes. You come in, get seated, order at the counter, and the wait staff will bring you the food. You get your own sauces (the whole bottle if you want, or you can pour them out), napkins, drinks, and dinnerware​.We didn't want to get too full, so we opted to do half a chicken combo and a burger with the Halloumi appetizer. Everything came out relatively quickly and we had just enough time to get our drinks, utensils​ and the sauces. Us being spoiled Americans, we were so glad to see ice and unlimited refills on soft drinks! The Fanta was really good.The Halloumi tasted like a water mozzarella​ cheese, but strangely tasty. The sauce was very sweet and just a tiny bit spicy. The chicken was very flavorful and really didn't need any sauce. It was a bit on the drier​ side, but I've had worse. The burger was very good, but I only had a bite so it's not fair for me to elaborate more. The green peas on the side were minty indeed, but definitely lacking salt. I ended up putting a ton of salt on it to make it more palatable.Overall, the experience was very pleasant and everyone was friendly. The tables are close to each other, so keep that in mind if you're not comfortable with it. We love spicy food, so we ended up purchasing a bottle of the X sauce to take home (though all sauces were delicious).P.S.We also ordered their wings roulette for take out. I'm not sure if it was just because we can handle spice or if none of them were spicy...but I don't think we got any spicy ones.

photos.caption: Photo of Nando's - London, United Kingdom. Some of the sauces.
Photo of Nando's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Nando's - London, United Kingdom. Halloumi

6Fl__F_S5xnZM41XJ8DfcQ.text: We are travellers and this was a new restaurant for us. Great location close to the tube. Staff were very helpful explaining how they operate. Basically you can sit down and look at a menu. Once you're ready to order you go up to the till and order and pay. Then sit and wait for service. It's a mix between fast food and sit down. The food was ok, and the sauces were very good. Portions were a bit smaller than I expected for £21.00, but the chicken was cooked perfectly. We had the boneless chicken with two large sides. Spicy Rice and mashed potatoes. Fairly simple. The place was very busy and that's what made us try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Nando's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Nando's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Nando's - London, United Kingdom

i4G5wrXB1QEVe9MBiyHOZg.text: We are here visiting London and in searching for a place to satisfy our hunger. We took the shuttle driver's advice and tried this Portuguese chicken  and it was the bomb. Nando's is the name of that restaurant and it's located at 204 Earls Court just steps from our hotel and Earl's Court underground station in South Kensington. The restaurant is small but has a nice ambiance and it gets really busy for dinner. Try the boneless chicken thighs with a couple of sides will surely satisfy your hunger. If you're in for the bones, the whole chicken platter with 2 large sides or 4 small sides will make 2 people happy. The creamy mash and the peas are my personal favorite sides. They made them just perfect. If you like red wine , try the Cara Viva! It's so smooth and will add more flavor for your taste buds. What else? It will set jour mood just right!

photos.caption: Photo of Nando's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Nando's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Nando's - London, United Kingdom

T4JyMa4ehfUqpZaTZJihVg.text: I went here for a quick dinner, so I ordered to go.  Unfortunately, I watched as 4-5 people who ordered after I ended up getting their food before me.  My friend ordered the same food as me except I ordered spicy rice, so we figured that was what took so long.  Unfortunately, I barely got any.  The bottom of the box that it came in was not even completely covered.  For the amount it cost, I expected more than two spoonfuls of rice.  I was incredibly disappointed and will not be going to this Nando's location again in the future.

EhTn_bYP9px8PPMKn2sx7Q.text: Very nice food. Well flavored and really fast service. Best part is it caters to vegetarians too. Being a foreigner we mistook the haloumi for chicken .. the manager sorted out the confusion and gave fries for free for coming back to sort out the confusion. We had dinner every night we were in London ..The hot spice is pretty spiccu but not tear inducing spice.

mcThXHUbiFlnp3lIkz6kkQ.text: My girlfriend and I decided to try Nando's randomly for dinner since we saw a few of its locations in London. We had never heard of Nando's before, but after doing some research we realized how globally popular it really was and deservedly so!It was pretty crowded when we visited for dinner because of how busy the area was. There was about a 15 minute wait, but it was worth every second. Once we were informed that a table opened up for us, we were told to order at the cash register and the food would be brought to us.We both ordered their popular Peri Peri chicken with 2 sides, my girlfriend the1/4 and me the 1/2. The bottom line was that this was some of the best roast chicken we had ever had - flavorful, very juicy and leaving us wanting much much more! This quality food definitely did not belong in a fast food restaurant as it tasted so much better! Oh and don't forget the unlimited amount of sauce they allow you to use. There were a variety of flavors that you could use.The sides were also excellent too, as I had the Peri fries and red skin mashed potatoes and my girlfriend had the Portuguese rice and corn on the cob. The fries were like thick cut frites and there was a ton of it on my dish. We're aware that Nando's exists in the states, but we're praying and hoping that they open one up soon near us in New York!

photos.caption: Photo of Nando's - London, United Kingdom. 1/4 Chicken with Spicy Rice and Corn on the Cob
Photo of Nando's - London, United Kingdom. Interior
Photo of Nando's - London, United Kingdom. Menu

u1PGJgM7ubo3V1F2XIBsUg.text: It has been about 7 years since I was in London.  I was longing for Nando's.  I get the sauces back home and make my own wings, but there is always something about going to the source.  In this case, I should have just lived with the memory.  First, the service is a little wonky.  Point you at a table, hand you a menu, give a brief instruction and leave you alone.  There are not a lot of tables, so it is not great for larger crowds.  If you are waiting on a table, you need to sit in the entry way.Second, and most importantly, the wings must have been procured from a 4 month old chicken.  Yes, I raise chickens so I know how big they are.  Last time I went to Nando's they were serving meaty wings with lots of flavor.  Now, they seem to just be another shop on the highstreet.  Too bad.  But, their sauce is still awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Nando's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Nando's - London, United Kingdom

g4JjNdf6Xpymi4Nq6mSIrA.text: Food is ok. Service at this location is horrible. Waited over 40 minutes because they forgot to make our food. Not even an apology.

Yw0ttJXP3fJo89oeaquQTA.text: Agree with current 4 star ratingPassed by this location frequently and always packed even at odd/late hours, so wanted to try. Although a chain, it's very good for Portuguese style rotisserie chicken with peri-peri hot sauce.   Sauces mainly vary in level of spiciness.  Like the herb and garlic sauces best.  Even "mild" is very spicy. Place is also great for take away/to go.  It's best to eat the food that day.  Thought the chicken was super tender and moist first day then seemed tougher next day (still tasty though).

2SpL_ZzDJyestHEyuBmrTQ.text: Great food! Although bit pricey for the portion you get. If you love spicy food, definitely recommend trying their extreme spicy sauce!

MGtjo9Q0cujRjnEn0K8zWg.text: Amazing food! Something you just don't get access to often. The Peri-Peri chicken is out of this world good! Different spice levels allow you to truly customize your heat levels. Add some pomegranate sauce and sweeten that spice! Great experience! As always, crying babies rule the universe though....what can do!

photos.caption: Photo of Nando's - London, United Kingdom. Add some of the many choices in sauce
Photo of Nando's - London, United Kingdom. Peri-Peri chicken breast with 2 sides

ERfNMGCMI1mXd-R6tAaiww.text: I ate here twice in my 4day trip to London in May...the food is really really good...my best Nandos...prefer to the African counterpart...the staff are attentive and friendly without being in your face! My favorites are the chicken tighs and sweet potatoes...you can't get them this good anywhere else...the garlic bread and corn tho...yum yum yum...If you love mango then you should try the Mango quencher and mango froyo...awesome!!Great job Alfredo, Kasia, Cute guy at the till and everyone here....I felt so comfortable even though I was eating alone.Come with an appetite or a friend with a large one...See you next time...

photos.caption: Photo of Nando's - London, United Kingdom. Frozen mango yogurt...topped with pomegranates (mine)
Photo of Nando's - London, United Kingdom. Chicken Tighs, Beans, Corn and Sweet Potatoes

aP_1hQM1_m69uD4d_Pp0lQ.text: London is so bloody expensive. I've been waiting since 2004 for prices to drop, the dollar to catch up to the pound, something! But surprise, surprise, nothing has happened and nothing will any time soon.In 2004, tight on cash, a friend introduced me to this chain. It was my first introduction into food in the UK that had great flavor. From then on, I learned a valuable lesson: If you like a blast of flavor in your food, find the ethnic food in the city. Nando's, a Portuguese chicken joint, fits the bill! I get the pita, like it spicy, and get the chips as well. The mango drink is nice if it's a rare warm day as well!

Pp7ANsAYlekxPeZHpnC_YQ.text: The prices are steeper than what we're used to in the states, but the chicken is good. Nice and spicy, and there are sauces at the dishware/condiment station if you're into something hotter than you ordered. The chips were also good but the coleslaw was not. The ambiance is... corny at best. Wish I just got chicken and chips to go.

BBUD6vb0dyGaw1zBXA8MDA.text: I can't believe this is a fast food place. The chicken is one of the best I've had. I ordered the 1/4 chicken which comes with your choice of 2 sides. I got the spicy rice(not spicy) and the side salad. I also ordered a beer and my total was about 12 pounds. Note to Nando's: Please open a Nando's in the States. Specifically NYC.

Sm_SW5vGDhSfqcFuW-wV6Q.text: Pretty tasty relatively cheap (not as cheap as Chipotle or other chicken places in USA) eats. esp. in London!  Not quite as good as El Pollo Loco but they make everything fresh!   Spicy is not very spicy. Still worth a try.

6ti5c4W3ISgtWJRKejO-hg.text: This is like a El Pollo Loco in UK.Their chicken is juicy but not as flavorful as I would like them to be. You don't get much food here either, but just enough to fill you up.Make sure to ask for a stamp card! free stuff on the fourth purchase! :)

zM1KJoO29xndrx6zaeVrPQ.text: Complete rip off!! We are used to Nando's in Australia which is far cheaper and much nicer. My wrap was completely filled out with lettuce with a small amount if chicken. The chips were cold and seemed as though they'd sat around for hours then shoved on our plate. It cost us nearly AU$50 for 2 meals that wouldn't cost more that $24 at home. Ripped off and the food was very average - not value for money!

3SY68Fo0VVb9IJHh3RfECg.text: My first meal in London, yay! My friend and I came in for dinner and I was quite surprised since she said it was a chain. You order at the cash register and they bring your food out for you. All the sauces are self-serve.I had the Butterfly Chicken Medium (I should have went a level higher since I love my flavors bolder) and it was quite good. Add a kick of their house sauce for some heat. Their garlic bread was REALLY delicious- one of the better ones I've had. The rice was pretty good and flavorful.A nice variety of people come here to eat so it was quite comfortable. Prices were also pretty good for the amount of food I had.

5895Nnk5MIRTIBb9i9lhSQ.text: Absolutely great service for a quick in and out trip! Love the Mediterranean salad ...
